div.p: You’ll never catch anyone... I had an old detective inspector say to me you’ll never catch anyone sat on your backside in the nick
you need to be out on the road because that’s where they are, they don’t come in here and hand themselves in. Paperwork, the bane of
every copper’s life and they’ll be saying it for ever and a day but it was for me... One thing I didn’t want to get involved in in the Police
and did on occasion and it never sat right with me was dealing with child abuse and stuff like that I think you’ve got to have a right mindset
for it and you’ve got to be very tolerant; I liked dealing with drug dealers, what you see is what you get with those individuals, with these people
that are committing child abuse and stuff like that they’re cunning, conniving and not my cup of tea, I’d rather deal with older villains than that
and seeing the damage that they cause to children and stuff it’s heart breaking really and, you know, it’s hard not to take it home with you
when you finish your day’s work, you know, and it does prey on your mind and stuff like that and for that reason I didn’t want to get involved
in that sort of work having done a couple of cases on the periphery but I didn’t want to get into it big time.
